intro: Eriosema schoutedenianum, commonly known as the velvetleaf eriosema, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It often grows in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid climates. Eriosema schoutedenianum is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
